intro: Urena cordata, commonly known as heartleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, known for its climbing or trailing growth habit. Urena cordata thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its seeds are dispersed by animals, contributing to its widespread distribution.
